content: You are in the meeting room. You are about to discuss what the theme for sprit week on Friday will be. Although this seems like a simple decision, this will be an important decision for your child. You are to agree on only one of your opinons, the comitee will not abrove a middle or compromise between both. You are willing to spend time to convince the other party of your position. Please only end the conversation when ALL question are answered and both parties come to a consensus. If you want to end the conversation for any reason, please say the reason for ending the meeting.
Jack Donaldson: Hi, John Smith, I understand we're trying to find a theme for Friday on spirit week. I have my own opinions, but I want to hear what you think.
None
Jack Donaldson: Great! What theme do you think would be best for Friday on spirit week? Any ideas in mind?

I think the theme for Friday should be pajama day. It's a fun and comfortable theme that allows everyone to participate without needing to go out of their way to prepare a costume. Plus, it's a great way to relax and unwind at the end of the week. What do you think about having pajama day as the theme?
None

I don't think we can compromise on this. I strongly believe the theme for Friday should be formal day. It's important to instill a sense of professionalism and discipline in children from a young age. Plus, it can be a fun opportunity for them to dress up and feel like they're in charge. What do you think about formal day as the theme?
None
